Posts.Content: Nov 15, 2007 04:56PM - edited Nov 15, 2007 05:02PM by bluedahlia I disagree.  I think stress has a lot to do with it.  Not only BC but any other disease that has the potential to cause our systems to start breaking down.  When we are stressed for long periods of time, our natural body chemistry changes.  The imbalance can cause the first link in the chain of the body's mechanism to break down.  The immune system (one of our most important mechanisms) that should take care of cancer cells can become compromised, and that's when it starts.  I look at it as a "falling card" effect.  That's how I see it, anyhow.

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 10:28AM - edited Nov 30, 2011 10:30AM by bluedahlia Princess, sorry, but I must disagree.  Many diseases are genetic in nature.  Many of the mutations are not yet known.  Saying you can treat those mutations with supplements and coffee enemas is just ludicrous.  I've been at this a lot longer than you, having had to deal with medical issues that you can't even imagine.  I have tried the holistic approach for those non-deadly issues and I an tell you, the only results I got was a case of kidney stones.  Please don't present your theories as fact.
